Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: PIGGOTTS
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a really good location for seeing the main sights of Istanbul, nothing fancy but just right for our needs, our room was comfortable and a nice size for our 3 night break. Good towels and crisp bed linen. 3 mins walk from the tram stop and a few mins from the Blue Mosque, Cisterns, Palace etc. The room we were allocated was not in the main hotel building but having read reviews we were aware this might be the case before we booked. Our room was clean and comfortable and the staff extremely friendly. Coffee and tea facilities were available in the room and air con. if required. Our room was located 2 floors up which was not a problem to us but may not suit everyone as there is no lift - not sure if main building offers a lift. A very good breakfast selection (hot and cold) was served in a large room with a fabulous terrace offering views of the Blue Mosque and surrounding area. Breakfast is served in another hotel which is a short stroll away (50-100 yards at most) down the road - it might not sound ideal but it really is not a problem and your reward is certainly worth the stroll. Overall we thought that this hotel was very good value for money and in an excellent location for our needs. Tip. Next door to our building was a travel agency that offered a service to the airport for 5.00 Euros each - really good value. On our arrival we caught the Light Railway which connects with the tram it only cost about 4 Euros (Probably not ideal if you have loads of luggage). A lovely spot to have a sundowner and dinner is under the Galata Bridge where you will find a really good selection of restaurants and places to sit and watch the world go by....fabulous. We did not use the river tours but caught local ferries which only charge about 2 Euros to visit the Asian side of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: via14
Reviews.Content: Central location but nice and quiet place close Hagia Sophia. Friendly and helpful staff. Comfortable and clean rooms. Very good breakfast on the terrace with nice view over Bosphorus, Sultan Ahmed Mosque and Hagia Spohia. Many good restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A couple visiting Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: A_MKH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hippodrome hotel for a week. Friendly staff, who spoke English very well. The breakfast was in another hotel across the street. It was on a roof terrace and had a great view. The breakfast was OK, a typical hotel breakfast. In the hotel lobby tea was served between 3-5pm. The hotel was small hotel and we had a small room but it was very clean. In the bathroom there was a tub/shower, a hairdryer, a total of 10 little bottles of different shower gels etc. cosmetics, slippers.... The room also had equipment to make your own coffee/tea. The room had a little balcony and a window opening to the street. All main tourist sites were near, a great location. The only con: no safety box in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Small Hotel with nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: Daniel123_12
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in this hotel. The rooms are not big but they are clean and the matress of the bed was very good. The Staff was nice and spoke English very well. Breakfast was in another hotel and was OK. Nothing extraordinary but fair for the money we paid. As the hotel is in Sultanhamet you can walk to the main attractions like Hagia Sophia.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for Location and Price”
Reviews.Author: reshma_desh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good for access to the Blue Mosque, and the tram line Sultan Ahmet. The grand bazaar is 15 mins leisurely walk away with lots of trinket shops along the way. There are NO: -shower caps -no slippers -no shower gels -no body creams -only 1 socket point -No room servicing after 16:00 -Breakfast is in another hotel about 1 min away via multiple up and down stairs and lifts ï�Œ +unlimited towels +unlimited teas and coffees +Free Turkish tea time in reception from 3-5 every day except Sunday +friends English speaking staff with good recommendations +Hairdryer +minibar +breakfast choice was good at the Obelisk Hotel The room was comfy and clean. You need ear plugs if you are not used to the prayer calls in the early mornings and throughout the day. Most taxi drivers cannot find this road for some reason :S

Reviews.Title: “Even more than I hoped for”
Reviews.Author: faughtandwon
Reviews.Content: I wanted a small hotel in a good location, close to attractions, and naturally, at a reasonable price. The Hippodrome had everything I wanted. I chose a less expensive room, without much of a view, because I was never in my room, and there is an awesome view from the restaurant at the Obelisk where enormous breakfasts are served. As a single woman, I appreciated the location and felt safe walking back and forth to the tram even late at night. If you stay long enough, the salesman up and down Ikbal Street will recognize you and stop trying to sell you something. The staff is friendly, gives good restaurant advice, and I learned lots of helpful Turkish phrases. Good heat on a cold winter's night - I was there over the winter holidays - and plenty of hot water. I would stay here again,

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel providing a brilliant base for exploring the city.”
Reviews.Author: Phthagan
Reviews.Content: Amazing location! 5min walk to Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. Very friendly and helpful staff. Room on small side with limited storage and somewhat eccentric plumbing. Very clean indeed and would be happy to come back. Breakfast was just across the street on rooftop terrace (fantastic view of Bosphorus) and very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Breakfast, Right Price”
Reviews.Author: Blabbott
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hippodrome for a week in November, 2011. The location is perfectly situated in the historic area and close to the major sites. We didn't stay in the main hotel, but had 3 rooms across the street at the Apt. The rooms were just fine, although the wifi was down the last 2 days. The staff at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast at the sister hotel (Obelisk) down the street had many choices including fresh orange juice and an assortment of cheeses. What I liked most was the price. We only paid 150 Euros for three rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay Ä±n Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Nimt B
Reviews.Content: I've been 9 days Ä±n thÄ±s hotel and Ä±t's been great. Staff is so gentle. His name's Caner Arzu. WÄ±th an excelent bathroom and yakusÄ± style bath. The breakfast amazÄ±ng, was almost the best food of the day, no joke. If I'd came agaÄ±n I'll book the same hotel and I'll recommend Ä±t to all my frÄ±ends.

Reviews.Title: “a very good choice, and really the best part of old istanbul”
Reviews.Author: iboegypt
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a triple bedroom at the Hippodrome apart in the second half of september 2011, on the corner of akbayik and mimar mehmet aga streets (actually the room was a overlooking the corner on the first floor), and although the stairs didn't give any positive first impression, the room was much better than expected, very clean, and an excellent breakfast not in the same hotel but another hotel (same owners) about fiifty metres away, but with a great view and excellent quality of food and service.

Reviews.Title: “Simple Option for Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: explore_2011
Reviews.Content: Very convenient Sultanahmet location. I stayed for 4 or 5 nights and felt very much at home. They have two properties for Hippodrome. I stayed a couple of nights in the apartments and then moved to the main location a few doors down. Main difference seemed to be no AC in the apartments and slightly nicer decor in the main location. Rooms were small, clean and furnished with eclectic furniture and rugs. Truly nothing special, but I would stay there again if I wanted to be in Sultanahmet. Single room was about $100 US including a nice buffet breakfast that was better than many others I had in Turkey. The desk staff started out friendly and throughout the stay remained very polite and professional. Something makes me feel that they lost a bit of interest in me when they found out I was not going to book tours or need much concierge service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Arifeko C
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Istanbul and we stayed for 4 nights at the Hippodrome Hotel with friends.We were not sure of the location, but found that it was close to the main attractions in Sultanahmet Area, all within walking distance. The staff(Caner,Sumer,Arzu) were very helpful and breakfast was more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: carobama
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week exploring this amazing city and this hotel as home base was perfect! The staff was friendly, helpful and English speaking. My husband was wise enough to book a triple room, which gave us an extra twin bedroom to store our clothes and use as a dressing room. This is a must have, as the main room and closet would be too small for comfortable living. The hotel has a wonderful old world charm. The breakfast, at the nearby Obelisk Hotel was wonderful. It is a definitely a source of pride for the whorls in Istanbul to offer a very nice breakfast. This does not mean western style. Try the dried fig and local yogurt and the many different kinds of cheese. We loved our stay. We were steps from everything in the Sultanahmet and our hotelier, Simir (Summer) put up with my bad Turkish with a smile everyday. Great value, location and local flavor.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: Khalid973
Reviews.Content: Great Location in heart of the old city.. Room is quite good, but the toilet so bad. friendly staff For the breakfast they told us to go to another hotel in front of us due the poor of the facilities in our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sultanahmet Gem - Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Matt G
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights and would do so again. Walking distance to most major sites in the area. Samir at front desk/concierge was an extremely helpful, knowledgeable and resourceful guy. Ten percent discount with Rick Steves Istanbul guide. Lots of restaurants close by. Breakfast at Best Western sister property across the lane was excellent. Rooms were clean and air conditioning worked. Afternoon tea a nice touch. Airport pick up included, but since we arrived by ship and didn't need pick up they instead arranged transfer to the airport for our departure. Small rooftop patio available for relaxing. Great view from there.

Reviews.Title: “Calm in the storm...”
Reviews.Author: SpriteyChicagoland
Reviews.Content: My 15 year old son and I stayed in this charming little hotel~it's not modern nor elegant, but charming in it's quirks~got to hear some local music from the restaurant nearby, got to go for short evening strolls to see the amazing sights and scenes, tremendous breakfast at the Best Western, helpful and friendly staff~homey.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: YOICO
Reviews.Content: There may be other better places around but we'll definitely stay here again. Close to Blue Mosque but a bit hard to find (there's Hippodrome Apartment hotel nearby also). So speak to free student guides in blue T-shirts and you'll be fine. Great breakfast with a great view at the Best Western (its sister hotel) across from the hotel. Tea, coffee, and snacks offered free of charge between 3 and 5 pm. A few mini supermarkets around. Initially booked one night but we wanted to stay longer, however, fully booked,,, what a shame. Just comfortable and nice. Go stay there.

Reviews.Title: “SUPER!!!”
Reviews.Author: natalya_sam
Reviews.Content: I have been to hippodrome hotel for 3 nights. Really wonderfull service, very friendly staff and actionally Samir was very helpfull and attentive. He is given all information for me. If I come back to Istanbul I'll stay exactly to Hippodrome hotel and I recommend everyone this hotel. It is very near for historical part and all museums.

Reviews.Title: “So so experience. Avoid the Apartment Annexe!”
Reviews.Author: wpg01
Reviews.Content: Ok front desk. Were initially put in their Apartment Annexe property up the street. It was terrible. They kindly agreed to move us to a room in the main building, which proved to meet our expectations. Not very big (actually almost small), but then not too expensive either. What was really nice was the breakfast on the roof of the nearby Best Western which was included. Huge spread with nice views of the Bosphorous. May consider another stay, but then there are also lots of other good (poss. better) options in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “A charming boutique hotel in the heart of Istanbul's Sultanahmet area”
Reviews.Author: Musafir_frm_NJ
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research on the internet and deliberating with the family, we decided on this hotel and believe me there is absolutely no regret in picking Hotel Hippodrome. It is not only conveniently located within minutes of almost every major attraction in Istanbul (Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Hippodrome etc.), it is also very comfortable and with a charming homelike atmosphere. The rooms and bathrooms are clean and made every day. The breakfast buffet is arranged at the top of the adjacent Best Western and is not to be missed. The view is absolutely breathtaking. The hotel staff are extremely helpful and friendly. Everyone of them would go out of their way to ensure your comfort. We would specially like to thank Sinan, Canen, Arzu, Samir and Murat for the excellent service they provided us. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. If you are looking for comfort and convenience in a friendly place, then look no furtherâ€¦â€¦however if you are looking for a large hotel with the likes of the Marriot, the Wyndham or the Hilton, then you need to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: Dpappas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hippodrome hotel while on our honeymoon. The location was perfect, hagia Sofia and the blue mosque only 5 mins away, lot of good restaurants nearby. And although it is in a busy area it wasn't too noisy at night. The rooms were very clean and cozy with comfortable clean beds. The service was great, Simar at the front desk was always there to help us plan our day, book tours and answer any questions. This hotel definitely helped to make our trip to Istanbul amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: li0nheart
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hippodrome Hotel through Booking.com and got a better rate (50 Euro for a single per night, breakfast included) than advertised on their website. My flight arrived at Ataturk Airport at 1 a.m. so I arranged through email with the hotel to provide transportation (25 Euro). Everything went smoothly and I stayed in a nice room in another building across the street from the main hotel. It was charming, the neighborhood was nice, and it was well located--very easy to get to the sights. The desk people were friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was served at the nearby Best Western. The breakfast was very good and the view from the terrace was spectacular. It was a pleasant stay in a delightful part of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - we liked the hotel and would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Eilinel
Reviews.Content: Rooms where clean and there was at fridge in the room. Also there was a small kitchen to share with the other rooms on our floor. The staff was friendly and helpfull and spoke English. The hotel location is great - between Hagia Sofia and the blue Moske. Walking distance to everything in the old city

Reviews.Title: “Good location, knowledgeable staff, clean comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Jennyclum
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hippodrome Hotel the week following Easter 2011. the city was crowded. So our room rate was rather high around $200 a night. The Hippodrome was a clean comfortable, quiet place to rest . The staff --front desk and reservations-- speak several languages and are courteous and organized. Samir at the front desk always checked that we knew the hotel's location and had the hotel phone number and address before we would go out. He was a great help during our stay. Our room was impeccably clean as was the bathroom. The bed looked and felt new. Linens were changed in the bath daily and the bed linens always fresh. the room has a small refrigerator and equally small TV. But who watches TV on vacation. The hotel is close to the Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque etc. The hotel is just around the corner from some busy restaurants, shops and crowds but the street in front is quiet. Although the hotel does not have a restaurant, the breakfast buffet at its related Best Western across the street was very good. they offered a large selection of European breakfast foods and drinks. The view of the sea and Asian Istanbul was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Modest but charming small hotel near Blue Mosque”
Reviews.Author: SoloChickinLA
Reviews.Content: Don't expect a lot of frills like room service or a business center, but instead be pleasantly surprised at english language stations on the tv, flawless in-room WiFi and extremely comfy bedding. While I would not recommend staying in Sultanahmet (the salespeople and hustlers are unbelievably pushy & obnoxious), if you must stay there, Hippodrome is a very solid choice. No complaints whatsoever.Noise was not a problem, although you will definitely hear call to prayers very clearly. Charming, modest little hotel. If you need to print out boarding passes or the like, they send you to the Best Western facililties (for free) just a few feet away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: rojrahman
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a central location close to Hagia Sofia, the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace. The service was excellent, the staff in particular Samir the receptionist was very helpful, polite and friendly. The room I had was actually very good for a family - a double room attached to a room with 2 single beds. Book here and you wont be dissapointed. By the way there are restaurants along the same street as well as general stores. Mohammed, North Lincolnshire, UK

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Richard_and_Moira
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Hippodrome having spent a few days there in early 2009. We really liked it then given its perfect location, reasonable rooms and great value - and this time it was no different. If you're after a no-hassle, value place in the centre of the Sultanahmet area it's hard to go past the Hippodrome. Special mention for the fantastic buffet breakfasts at the sister hotel just down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Tsuleman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night cried all night room was tiny asked for double bed were given twin single room, I booked 2 weeks before going still wasnt given what I wanted! Room smelled of cigarette smoke and body odours! The reservation manager arzu was rude and loud didn't even acknowledge fault on there part!

Reviews.Title: “turkish delight”
Reviews.Author: meltemManchester
Reviews.Content: what can I say even from the first greeting by Samir I knew we had chosen the perfect place for our trip to Istanbul and it progressed from better to the best. to say the least we were made to feel that this was our home in Istanbul and even the people in the surrounding area made us feel so welcome. Without doubt would return time and again to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Stephene81
Reviews.Content: Very nice boutique hotel, clean, large rooms, rich breakfast with a view to the sea, good position; friendly and competent staff (special thanks to Mr. Caner, Mr. Samil)

Reviews.Title: “Very well located with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MalcJPM
Reviews.Content: I travelled here over the valentines weekend with my girlfriend for a sightseeing getaway. I chose the hotel for it location in the heart of the Sultanahmet district. Very glad I did now as we had an excellent trip, facilitated by the hotel. The service we received was excellent, from first arrival to check out. Many thanks to Samir at the front desk who made our stay very pleasant with his advice and friendly demeanour. The other staff were equally as helpful, and always willing to try and overcome any language barrier. The room itself was lovely. With the price paid I wasn't expecting a lot, but the room was furnished with authentic local decoration, and was well maintained and clean (as was all of the hotel). From our room's balcony we could see the magnificent Blue Mosque, and we had a view out over the sea of Marmora. Whilst I appreciate not everyone will have this, all the rooms we saw seemed spacious and well cared for. The hotel is spread over two sites along the same street, with breakfast and meals provided from another hotel further along. We had breakfast included, which was well worth it. Running from 0730 to 1030, the timings are perfect for sightseers wanting an early start, or for those wanting a more relaxed morning. The food is standard fare, and it keeps you going until lunch. It is worth noting again the excellent location of the hotel. A five minute walk to the nearest tram stop and the Blue Mosque. The Aya Sofia, Topkapi Palace and the Basilica Cistern are all within ten minutes walking distance, and once you are on the tram, you have access to the whole of the city. My least favourite part of the hotel was the lack of a lift to the top floor where we were located... it would have been much treasured after a day's sightseeing! It could also be a little noisy on the street below, but this is part and parcel of being in a busy district.

Reviews.Title: “Second time in the same place”
Reviews.Author: Irina42
Reviews.Content: Firs time we've been in Hippodrome hotel in summer 2009, in february 2011 back in it again! Hotel is very good! Located in great place, very close from all best places of interest! ON RECEPTION YOU CAN SPEAK RUSSIAN, it is great! Thanks for Samir!!!! He help us with everythink we need. Next time in Stunbul we sure stay in this plase again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rustemufa
Reviews.Content: Very lovely hotel one minute walk from Blue Mosque and Haya Sophia. The personnel very friendly and helpfull. Special thanks to reception guy Samir for his will to help for any our request. Cheers Rustem and Lidia

Reviews.Title: “Great location, affordable, quiet, pleasant personnel”
Reviews.Author: Ivan_J_11
Reviews.Content: I am Ivan from Belgrade, Serbia. I've stayed in Istanbul, at Hippodrome Hotel for five nights in January 2011. Istanbul alone is a magnificent city, full of history, life, amazing monuments and picturesque sceneries. Hotel Hippodrome perfectly fitted. Its location, pleasant, prompt and helpful personnel, affordable price... Surely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT EXPERIANCE AT THE HIPPODROME HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: ramonagalea
Reviews.Content: The hippodrome hotel is situated in the heart of sultanahmed which is located in the centre of istanbul where someone can find all the sightseeing and shopping outlets. We would like to give a big thanks to samir for his service, hospitality and all the advices about istanbul as he was really helpfull about what to do,thanks alot once again for doing our holiday. It was a wonderfull experience as all the turkish people are really friendly and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “The Best People”
Reviews.Author: NashwaYemen
Reviews.Content: Hi ,My name is Nashwa I am from Yemen .This was the first time for me in Turkey ,I had no idea where to go and how but those nice people had showed me the right and the most intersting way to spend my vacation in Turkey. Every thing was outstanding I am very happy and next time ofcourse I will choose only this hotel for my saying. and Samir the receptionist is very kind and helpfull ... Thank you Nashwa

Reviews.Title: “Never had such a great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Fate77
Reviews.Content: I would really like to thank the Staff at this Hotel (Samir the receptionist & Arzu the Hotel Manager) for their kindness, hospitality, and the smiling faces the show at the customers. As such, i would like to strongly recommend all visitors to come and spend their holidays at this Hotel; technically, everyone likes to spend such a great time while on vacation in a clean, cheap and in a good location Hotel! Believe me! you have all of that in this Hotel. Nothing has forced me to write this recommendation, but the way I feel happy and impressed about the service here. Lastly and again, I have seen nothing but an outstanding service at this Hotel, and is going to be my home in Turkey from now on:) Samir Alarami. U.S.A.

Reviews.Title: “This is a nice hotel with a chic location in the heart of Sultanahmet, very friendly and responsive the manager Samir!!!”
Reviews.Author: Wert888
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in close proximity to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia in a quiet street. The staff and especially manager Samir will assist you in any matter from early morning until late at night!!! Included breakfast liked their abundance, and wonderful views from the panoramic terrace on the sea of Marmara and the Bosphorus!!! Samir has given us the necessary information about leisure and shopping in Istanbul!! The next trip we will stop at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and great value”
Reviews.Author: AminAli
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel. It is very close to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia and other main sites. The staff were nice and the room was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel,Amazing Staff,Amazing Manager!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: louisis
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay at Hippodrome Hotel. The manager and staff were warm, helpful , friendly and eager to do anything to assist us. Rooms comfortable and spacious. Breakfast had good variety and location to Blue Mosque and Topaki Palace excellent. Roof terrace with views to Mosque and Bosphorus. Highly recommend this hotel.I will definitely stay at the Hippodrome Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful holiday Ä±n Ä±stanbul”
Reviews.Author: albertotrieste
Reviews.Content: we recomanded for everybody because everythÄ±nghs Ä±s very good. The staff Ä±s very kÄ±ndly and athmospahre Ä±s frÄ±endly .SamÄ±r Ä±s helpfull and he Ä±s a very smÄ±le . RaccomandÄ±amo questa scelta per la posÄ±zÄ±one molto vÄ±cÄ±na aÄ± sÄ±tÄ± dÄ± Ä±nteresse . E'ben servÄ±ta daÄ± mezzÄ± pubblÄ±cÄ± che la collegano facÄ±lmente aÄ± varÄ± quartÄ±erÄ± della cÄ±tta. La sÄ±mpatÄ±a del personale cÄ± ha conquÄ±statÄ±: SamÄ±r e' sempre dÄ±sponÄ±bÄ±le e lo trovÄ±amo ad accoglÄ±ercÄ± ognÄ± volta con un sorrÄ±so e tanta sÄ±mpatÄ±a. Perfetto! :)

Reviews.Title: “The Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: naseto
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really nice. It is situated in close proximity to the Blue Mosque in a quiet old neithbourhood. Me and my husband were especially happy with the hotel service. The front desk man Samir was very nice and polite. He was smiling the whole time and was always willing to help us.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff and thanks Sammer for great turkish night”
Reviews.Author: Greenius
Reviews.Content: we had great time in hippodorma hotels nice clean room , helpful staff near to most interesting location as blue mosque & H Sofia plus metro station which can leading around the city , and when you arrived to hottel ask Samer to arranged to you Turkish night in sultanah thnaks Greenius

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings Great location yes but pretty basic”
Reviews.Author: LePetitPrince-Yaz
Reviews.Content: So this hotel is a jump and leap away from the major attractions in that area. Getting to hotel using the metro system was easy from the airport, ~roughly 45min to an hour. I travel light so carrying my bag from the Tram to hotel was ok. But if you are travelling with several pieces of luggage person consider getting an airport transfer. And be prepared to walk through major touristy area. I didn't at all mind going down 2 blocks for the complimentary breakfast. Inspiring view of the water. BUt the breakfast was the same every day I was there (4 days) Not too much of a selection. The room was basic, with the decor and linens seeming a little older. BUt let's be realistic you will probably only spend time at the hotel to sleep. There is so much to do and explore in Instabul. Lots of great little shops around. The A/C was decent, also older and it tool some time to cool the room. I was there in september and wonder what it would have been like if I went during the really warm season. Sulthmet is a very busy and touristy area. All though the hotel was close to major attractions I was wishing to stay in another area. I wondered if staying at a different location and spending slightly more would have been worth it. The front desk people were extremely helpful and cheerful. They made coming back to the hotel a great experience. I would recomment the hotel if all you are looking for is a bare minimum hotel for a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel in excellent location- Ilker at reception could not be more helpful”
Reviews.Author: susiegorman
Reviews.Content: Breakfast location at sister Great Western Hotel had marvellous views over the marmara sea and Blue Mosque All very friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Others are right - great location for a small boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: lammejn
Reviews.Content: The only reason I'm not giving this hotel 5 stars is because in spite of my 2 month in advance reservation and one week in advance confirmation, my request for a lg rm wasn't met when I arrived. (Since I am staying for 5 nites, I thought it reasonable to ask for a larger rm.) I WAS moved to a wonderful rm (#502) complete with many windows and an accessible kitchen so I am very, very happy. Sameer, the day manager, is very eager to please and couldn't do a better job. Also, the hotel is right in the middle of the very active tourist area so can be noisy until 10 at night but a couple of ear plugs with the double glazed windows seems to take care of that. Also very clean and friendly staff. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended, a great hotel with excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: nita9899
Reviews.Content: The hotel is within walking distance of all the major sites in the neighborhood of Sultanahmet. This cozy hotel is warm and inviting. Rooms are on the small side, but the service more than makes up for that. The staff, particularly the front desk employees, were incredibly friendly, very welcoming, and extremely helpful - they were always ready and willing to answer our questions and help us make plans. The complimentary buffet breakfast was great, especially with the spectacular views of the Bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LITTLE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: demozeleski
Reviews.Content: If you are an independent traveler and like value for your money, this is your kind of place. The location is great for walking to the major sites ( Blue Mosque Hagia Sophia) and the tram to other sites is close. The breakfast is excellent. Some folks complain because you walk across the street for breakfast but they should stay some place that charges twice as much so they won't have to snivel about small stuff. The view from the breakfast room was great. We stayed in room 101. It had a double bed and a small additional room with a single bed that we used to hold our baggage. The very best thing about the hotel is Samiar, the day time manager. Very friendly, helpful, and interested in talking with people. I don't know who the boss is but he needs to give Samiar a raise. No, we are not related, but I cannot say enough good things about him and how he can make your trip more enjoyable in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Funky but Nice”
Reviews.Author: remittancegirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hippodrome for ten days. It's a tiny, funky little hotel that seems to be spread over a couple of buildings. Our first room was a little pokey and small, but clean and fine. But the staff offered us a larger room without any prompting once they realized we were staying so long. The beds were comfortable, the rooms were clean and the staff were really kind, friendly and helpful. Breakfast is at another building a few steps down the street on the rooftop with an amazing view of the Bosporus. It doesn't have a lot of amenities, and it's slightly over-priced, but no worse than most of the hotels in Istanbul. The staff made it a very pleasant stay and the internet connectivity was free, excellent wifi (very important to me). The location was perfect for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “A Gracious Stay in Instanbul”
Reviews.Author: wildflowermeadow
Reviews.Content: The Hippodrome is a lovely boutique hotel located within walking distance to the Blue Mosque, and the Aya Sofia. The staff was very helpful and gracious. The rooms were tastefully decorated and comfortable with double-paned windows. The rate includes a bountiful breakfast at a nearby hotel. I would stay here again when visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A great friendly place to stay at”
Reviews.Author: flyinghamster
Reviews.Content: As reviewers already mentioned, the location and the rooftop breakfast are phenomenal. Staff both in hotel building as well as the apart hotel which is just up the road are very friendly. We were staying on the 3rd floor of the apartment building, first in a cosy room which provides you with everything you need on holiday. After the first night we got relocated to the adjacent apartment which also had a terrace entrance. The apartment and the terrace were spacious and the view from the terrace makes dining "at home" just as romantic an experience as in rooftop terrace restaurants in the vicinity, added the privacy. All in all, a clean friendly place providing you with essentials for your trip. Not on the luxurious or posh side but definitely worth staying at.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but not what we thought it was going to be!”
Reviews.Author: Travellinaussies
Reviews.Content: My mother booked what we thought was a 3 bedroom apartment at the Hotel Hippodrome but when we arrived we were in a different building, not the one pictured on the internet, and in 3 different rooms on 3 different levels of the building, only accessible via an old, very steep, staircase. Luckily one room was on level one so mum was able to take that room & climb the stairs without too much difficulty. The rooms were clean, spacious and comfortable which is all we really ask for in a basic hotel but we were disappointed to find it was not what we thought we were getting (nothing like the pictures on the websites!). We were allowed to use the internet free of charge down the road at the main Hippodrome hotel which was useful. Breakfast is at yet another hotel, further down the road again. The food was good but we noticed the table cloth was dirty on the first morning, and the same table cloth was still on there 4 or 5 days later! We dined at that hotel one evening. It was very expensive, and very bland food. There are much better restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: LondonMarcia
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Istanbul and i found this hotel absolutely in a perfect location. its just 5 min away from The Blue Mosque. My room was lovely with a double bed, sofa and nice chair. Friendly staff and the breakfast is excellent, you actually use Best Western Hotel opposite side of the road for breakfast, and the view from the Bosphorous is magnific.!!! Stay here and you wont be dissapointed also because this is the best area in Istanbul!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good not Great”
Reviews.Author: BarryandJackie
Reviews.Content: but it is what it is.... a good value for the money with a wonderful location in the Old City. The room was clean but fairly plain, although it was roomy than some other similar places we have stayed in this area (with a couple of chairs and a small coffee table). The TV was inoperable but that's probably not a permanent situation and what's more, if you are only staying overnight or even two nights, you won't want to spend all that much time in the room any ways. It was okay to walk down the block to the Best Western for breakfast, which was quite generous and does have a lovely rooftop view of the river. They do have one PC with internet access and wireless throughout the building which is a nice feature. The front desk, several people, were friendly but not overly helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, Superb view from breakfast terrace”
Reviews.Author: asarangi
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel to stay at. We stayed there twice --MArch and April 2010 and in March we got a room facing renovation in the back--was dusty and noisy--forget a nap in the afternoon, Almost gave up on this hotel but were pleasintly surprised in April to get a real nice room facing the street with a little balcony. The breakfast at the siter hotel across the street was fabulous and the view from the terrace there was MAgnificient. Overall a prretty noice experience. The manager Arzu was great and was very informative and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: lmingwall
Reviews.Content: The people running the hotel were so friendly, kind, nice, and very welcoming. The hotel is actually split between two buildings but the location is great. Easy walking distance to restaurants, shops and literally two minutes from the Blue Mosque. The hotel is small, no frills but extremely clean, nicely decorated, and again the service was fantastic. It was very inexpensive and included breakfast at the Best Western right down the street. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed - Sold Accomodation That Is Far From Description”
Reviews.Author: speedypreedy
Reviews.Content: We booked a family apartment on Expedia. When we arrived, it was not what we had booked. No separate living room, no terrace, no view of the sea. When we complained, we were told that the accomodation we had booked did not exist - and they were unable to move us. But, of course, we were still charged for "a room with a view!" with separate living area. Oh - and just to make things even worse, our accomodation was not in the main hotel, but a nice walk over the road ... and breakfast was in another location, further away. Breakfast location very nice (we actually had a view this time!) - but food was very poor. Not to be recommended. - although Istanbul fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed a welcoming hospitality”
Reviews.Author: gofore
Reviews.Content: Hippodrome Hotel is a budget hotel located in the center of town. Though we paid 40$ only (through Last Minute Travel web site) we had it all including internet access and refrigerator in the rooms. We enjoyed a welcoming hospitality and we would like to recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: lisaposty
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights for a leisure trip, and found this hotel to be absolutely everything that I needed it to be. Breakfast was lovely, a varied range of foods to choose from, including cereals, hot dishes, eggs, breads pastries pancakes and the most wonderful fresh honey dripping from the comb. The room although not large was very clean and pleasent, with a nice, very clean, bathroom with an excelent shower. The atmosphere in the hotel is very friendly and relaxing, and the staff were very good indeed. I was suprised at the quality of the bed linen which was changed frequently and very comfortable. The only thing that i would have liked (being a female) was a dressing table in the room, this would have just made the whole experience faultless instead of just brilliant value. Maybe too much to expect, as i cannot find fault with this hotel at all. The location is excellent for access to all of the major sights, and has very easy transport link for the rest of the city. Well done Hippodrome Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Great Value”
Reviews.Author: JimEveryCountry
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! Two nights; right in old-town. walking distance to Hagai Sophia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, train station. Breakfast included at Best Western 50 feet away. Free wi-fi. Super friendly staff. Great restaurants all around. Inexpensive (US$10 dinner).

Reviews.Title: “Great position, clean, good value”
Reviews.Author: coppinpr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly situated between the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophfia and just 8 min walk from the Topkapi entrance. There are at least 20 good places to eat within 2 mins walk as well as bars and small food stores. The hotel is small but looks good both inside and out and unlike some in the area has a lift. After checking out other reviews on tripadviser I asked for a room on the upper floors and although you can just about hear late evening noise from the night life in the street outside it is minimal and there was no noise from ajoining rooms although all were in use. Some reviews say the hotel dose not have air con and double glazing,our room had both and was very clean indeed, it was quite large but not huge. Also unlike other hotels in the area breakfast is included and was really first class. You need to walk 50yds to the sister hotel for the breakfast but its well worth it. The restaurant is on the roof with fantastic views of the Bosphorous and the blue mosque. The selection of food was as good as you will ever get in anything other than a 5 star hote and in many cases better than that. 4 or 5 hot items plus at least 6 cheeses 6 cold meats 6 pastries and breads as well as the usual cereals fruits ect, one very nice touch was 4 homemade jams and natural honey comb with the honey running out. This restaurunt also proved to be a good place to eat at night with very competitive prices for a place with such a great view. There are a few things to watch out for and avoid. We were put into the annex which is on the other side of the road from the main hotel, no lift or lounge here and we asked to be moved , they said this was no problem after the first night as all were booked on that night, we agreed but decide to stay with our first room as it was so clean and quiet. Rooms on the upper floors are a MUST, they are airier,quiter and some offer good views. Rooms do have a minimal mini bar but those in the annex do not have safe deposit boxes although the hotel dose advertise these (main building only perhaps). Staff were friendly and helpful and even the annex had free wireless internet connection. For the price(which was low) its hard to fault this hotel and I would stay there again. 5 star for its situation in town (even the Grand Bazzar was only 15 mins walk and there was a large taxi rank close by) 5 star for the included brekfast 4 star for the room (it could have been bigger and the bathroom a little more modern) 4+ for value for money

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: lexi0214
Reviews.Content: The staff is without exception extremely friendly and goes out of their way to help. Location is unbeatable right next to the market and 5-10 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. The breakfast was very nice and I enjoyed the quick stroll (about 1 minute) across the street to the rooftop restaurant with a view of istanbul. My first room was horribly noisy, but the staff immediately found me a replacement upon request and even upgraded me. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: The_Chebaros
Reviews.Content: Well we were 10 people and we had an 11 night stay! everything about hippodrome hotel is amazing...the rooms are fashionably decorated, clean, and cozy! although the breakfast room was at a nearby building, we weren't annoyed...the short walk (not more than 30 sec) was like a morning muscle stretch! ... the breakfast was so diversified (different types of cheese, tomato, olives, cucumber, many kinds of jam, omelette, cheese rolls, hot dogs, cereal, milk, yogurt, cakes, tea, coffee, ....) i almost forgot....hippodrome hotel has the most amazing view of the blue mosque, aya sophia, and the bosphorus sea from its terrace!! you can also enjoy the wireless internet in your room! and also book a massage session or something of this sort! well, the next time we come to istanbul we will for sure stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in centre of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: juditta99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had booked three nights in the Hyppodrome hotel and when we got there they told us that we would be staying in the appartment section of their hotel. The room was very nice, clean, good size and with a decent-sized bathroom. The staff were really friendly and helpful and seemed delighted to see us every time we came down the stairs! Its location is fantastic: a minute away from the Blue Mosque and all the other main sights in the Old City and a couple of steps away from a tram stop which will take you straight to the more modern part of Istanbul. The breakfast is served in their other hotel, just across the road on a lovely terrace. Good choice of food - just be careful with the seagulls who will steal your breakfast if you look away for more than a second! We had only booked the room for three nights as we werenÂ´t sure what our plans would be for the last two. However in the end we were so happy with the Hyppodrome that we decided to stay there for our last two nights there too. We definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Unforgettable!”
Reviews.Author: maydaymusic
Reviews.Content: My first week in SultanAhmet for our 3 months holidays in Istanbul. It was about midnight when we finally found the hotel. My husband wasn't happy with the room cause the bed is such as the sofa bed. Breakfast is not good. Limited Choice. But the location is very good for the area. Just a min walk to the Blue Mosque. There is one mini Bazaar round the corner that we did enjoy most of our nights there, Live Traditional Turkish Music and Konya Dance!!!

Reviews.Title: “It is perfect hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nyagah
Reviews.Content: I have liked the hotel and mostly the workers have been very social and cooperative.They made me feel like i am in my home country .When i needed some assistance they were ready to offer.Arzu (hotel manager) has been helping us and making us happy being in istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Handy Hippodrome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sobarch
Reviews.Content: Based on information from Rick Steves' Istanbul, my girlfriend and I booked a double room (two twin beds) in high season for 80 Euros a night, cash, for 9 nights. We were promptly picked up from the airport, each at our different arrival times/dates for no charge and had good service at check in. The staff were helpful, but unobtrusive. I wished I had asked for their help earlier, because when I did, they were very nice and willing. The room was a comfortable size for two people and very clean. Pros - good value for money, good service, clean, helpful, fantastic location. Excellent breakfast included at nearby Obelisk hotel. Cons - lower rooms smelled and we moved to upper room. Corridors smell of cigarette smoke. lumpy twin beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but we were not picked up as arranged”
Reviews.Author: Aussiecruzer
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Hotel Hippodrome prior to embarking on a cruise. The hotel is excellently located, easy walking distance from the Blue Mosque, Arasta Bazaar, Aya Sophia and Topkapi Palace, all of which we explored on foot the following morning. Our only problem was that pick-up from the airport was included in the booking and , although I had e-mailed Omer numerous times to ensure we would be met, and despite his assurances that someone would be waiting for us, when we arrived at the airport, no-one was there to meet us. We waited 1/2 hour then phoned the hotel, and the gentleman on duty (not Omer) said he would send his son. After another half hour of waiting we phoned again and he said someone was on the way. Finally a young man came after we had been waiting more than an hour. Not a great introduction to Istanbul! After that however, things were fine. The hotel is in a narrow cobblestoned street just behind the Blue Mosque. It was Ramadan and when we arrived in the evening there was music and dancing, and food stalls and fairy lights in the area around the Blue Mosque and we quickly fell under Istanbul's spell. As we walked out of the hotel and up the road we came across the Whirling Dervish at the Cafe Mescale and traditional music.( it was around 8.30 pm) We enjoyed local food and sweets at the food stalls. We had a family room which had a double bed, and a separate room with 2 single beds for our children. Bathroom was OK though the sink had a large crack in it. Breakfast was served the next morning at their sister hotel across the road on the rooftop terrace. Lovely food and wonderful view across the Bosphorous. Following breakfast we explored the sights - Topkapi Palace, Aya Sophia, Basilica Cistern etc. We made brief use of the free internet terminal at reception prior to check out. All in all a good stay, which would have been even better if we had been met as organised.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: TorontoMusicman
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the Hippodrome. The hotel arranged our shuttle in from the airport and each time we used their service (4 times) the driver was there waiting for us. The room was extremely clean and the maid service was excellent! The breakfast in the morning at the hotel across the street was exceptional, the best on our trip!! The hotel was close to the major attractions. Our only concern was that at night it was a bit noisy. But definitely worth staying there!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: travelbug6Kl
Reviews.Content: My family and i have just returned from Istanbul. We stayed at hippodrome apart hotel and we were quite happy to stay there. the place is located within walking distance to all the major attractions namely, blue mosque,hagia sofya,topkapi palace and basila cistern. the grand bazaar is two tram stops away (beyazit) but you can still walk there.The location is perfect eventhough the kitchen is not fully equiped and they do not have a dining table . Breakfast is at another hotel and its quite good eventhough it is almost the same daily.No complaint at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NatalieJayne
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel. Amazing location - very central to everything. We walked everywhere. Wonderful breakfast on the roof terrace overlooking the city and blue mosque. Nicely surprised and would book this hotel again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: Dave079
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the Hippodrome Hotel in Istanbul. The location was incredibly good within walking distance to all of the major sightseeings. The staff was very friendly and helpful. A big thank you to Derya who helped us with all the information and guidelines. We will definatly be going back to the Hippodrome Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: twicebitten_7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 9 days with hubbie and two children. Had two adjoining rooms, one double and two single beds but only one A/C and as it was hot needed to keep both doors open which might have been ok except for my snorning husband who kept us all awake despite being banished to his own room alone only we didn't have the heart to lock him in as he might suffocate without the cool. Not the hotels fault, the snoring. Otherwise no complaints, location great, daily cleaning and ample toilet paper! Double bed way comfortable, single beds a bit on the hard side. Didn't mind the short walk for the buffet breakfast , worth it for the view. Good value for money. Would stay there again anytime. Travel tips: Beware of the taxi man who made off with not only twice the going rate but also an extra 100YTL. We learned the public transport system pretty quickly after that and found it very easy for getting around. Also the cute cherry juice seller,all dressed up in his costume . No sooner has he the children at his side and urging u to take photo while proffering minute amount of juice in our cups when he lands u with the bill. My husband hates to look at the photo. It makes me laugh still. He reakons we should have run for it as he'd have been hard pressed to catch up carrying that thing on his back. He was still smarting after the taxi robber.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Luvs2laff
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed here last weekend and although we didn't spend much time in the room we had a great time. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is excellent, we had a nice view of the Blue Mosque from our room. The room was pretty average, comfy bed and pretty of space for the two of us. The only problem we had was with our taxi driver (nothing to do with the hotel though) Our taxi driver claimed to have been "lost", so we ended up having to call the hotel and have them talk to the driver, but the cost was about 36 YTL from the airport to the hotel. My best advice would be to print out the name of the hotel and make sure you let them know it's located in the sultanahmet (sp) area.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Funkysheep5
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hippodrome for a week at Easter 2007. I was travelling with my mother who is in her seventies. When we arrived we were advised that there was a problem with the room and we were taken a sister hotel for one night. The sister hotel was no better than a hostel. We had to sleep in a small double bed in a room that looked onto a wall without hot water. The room was dirty and the bathroom was appauling. The second day we were transferred back to the Hippodrome where were were placed in a large twin room. This was of a decent standard although the bathroom was not cleaned on a daily basis and we ran out of toilet roll twice as these were not replaced. Also, the restaurant was not open on the roof and we have to walk over the road to another hotel every morning for breakfast. Although this was inconvenient, the breakfast was good. The staff on reception could not speak very much English and were not helpful when it came to asking for direction.s We did complain and get a free taxi ride to the airport. The location of the hotel was excellent and with a little effort this could have been a much better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Transportation”
Reviews.Author: beech_bunnie
Reviews.Content: Although they told us that transportation was included, it was NOT! When we arrived at the airport, we were expecting to see a driver holding a sign with the hotel or our names on it but after waiting an hour for our ride, we finally ended up borrowing a local's cell phone. The hotel clerk told us to take a taxi and the hotel would reimburse us. The cost was approximately $20 US. When it was time for us to return to the airport, we asked the front desk clerk to call for a taxi. He called his friend/relative to pick us up and he charged us approximately $40 US!!! We would definitely have been better off hailing an anonymous taxi from the street than relying on the morning front desk man.
